result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Kopac

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:29 PM Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Nicole M Kopac.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Dismissed and Read-in to: 21CT1495 and 22CM6536.

$500.00 cash bond to be applied to costs on 21CT1495.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Nicole M Kopac.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received discovery on newest case, and requests a projected plea/sentencing hearing in about 60 days. Defense makes request to remove SCRAM monitoring as a bail condition or to amend bond on 22CM653 to Signature bond only. 
State agrees to address bond today. 
Defense makes statements in support of request to bail modification. 
State makes arguments in opposition to request for bail modification. 
For reasons on the record, the court will deny the request for bail modification.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicole M Kopac
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-20-2022)
Prior: 719 Surrey Lane, Hartland, WI 53029

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Not to be on any premises that serve/sell/provide alcohol - Only exceptions are the Grocery Store and not to enter the liquor department and a Gas Station. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration until further order of the Court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.

02:13 PM Defendant Nicole M Kopac in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
